title: 4 Simple Ways to Right-Click on Mac Computer

steps.title: Press the Control key and click.
steps.content: Press the Control key and click. Press and hold the Control (Ctrl) key while you click the mouse button. On the Magic Keyboard , this will be in the bottom-left corner. Release the button after clicking. [1] X Research source This method works for a 1-button mouse or trackpad and is identical to right-clicking with a 2-button mouse. Be sure to install any available updates on your Mac.

steps.title: Choose your desired menu item.
steps.content: Choose your desired menu item. When you Control-click, the appropriate context menu will appear. [2] X Research source The example below is a context menu in the Firefox browser.

steps.title: Open the Apple Menu and click System Preferences….
steps.content: Open the Apple Menu and click System Preferences… . On Ventura, this will be System Settings . This method works with all trackpad surfaces.

steps.title: Click Trackpad.
steps.content: Click Trackpad . This can be found next to the Mouse . On Ventura, locate Trackpad in the left panel.

steps.title: Enable Secondary click.
steps.content: Enable Secondary click. Check the box for Secondary click , then select Click or tap with two fingers . You will see a short video example of the proper way to click.

steps.title: Use a two-finger click.
steps.content: Use a two-finger click. Go to the Finder , and as shown in the video, tap two fingers on the trackpad. [3] X Research source A context menu should appear.

steps.title: Open the Apple Menu and click System Preferences….
steps.content: Open the Apple Menu and click System Preferences… . On Ventura, this will be System Settings . [4] X Research source This method works with the Apple Trackpad.

steps.title: Click Trackpad.
steps.content: Click Trackpad . This can be found next to the Mouse . On Ventura, locate Trackpad in the left panel.

steps.title: Enable Secondary click.
steps.content: Enable Secondary click. Check the box for Secondary click , then select Click in bottom right corner or Click in bottom left corner . You will see a short video example of the proper way to click. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Use a corner-click.
steps.content: Use a corner-click. Go to the Finder , and as shown in the video, press one finger on the bottom right or bottom right of the trackpad. A context menu should appear.

steps.title: Buy a separate mouse.
steps.content: Buy a separate mouse. Mac's Magic Mouse doesn't appear to have two buttons, but it can be programmed so the right-hand side responds like a second button. If you don't want to buy a Mac mouse, any two button mouse can be programmed to work with a right click on a Mac.

steps.title: Connect your mouse
steps.content: Connect your mouse . This is often as simple as plugging in the USB dongle and using it right away, but if your mouse is more complicated, follow the directions it came with. [6] X Research source Make sure your mouse is charged .

steps.title: Enable your right-click
steps.content: Enable your right-click if needed. Any mouse with two built-in buttons should just work right away. You'll be able to right-click, as you otherwise would on another computer. However, a Mac-specific mouse like a Magic Mouse will need the settings adjusted to enable this. Click the Apple Menu. Click System Preferences or System Settings . Click Mouse . Allow Enable Secondary Click .
